titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding China's membership in the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC).
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding China's membership in the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC).

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Africa, Global Health, Global Human Rights and International Organizations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.

committee.subcommittee: Africa, Global Health, Global Human Rights and International Organizations
committee.name: House Foreign Affairs

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should: (1) vote against China (PRC) regaining United Nations Council on Human Rights (UNHRC) membership and encourage other members to vote against its election, and (2) encourage another member to stand for election as an alternate candidate from the Asia-Pacific region.
